sections.heading: Act, how construed.The Nebraska Agricultural Products Marketing Act shall not be construed:(1) As altering the provisions of any other act or acts dealing with the marketing of agricultural products or as detracting from the authorities provided for in any such acts;(2) As empowering the department
sections.text: Act, how construed.The Nebraska Agricultural Products Marketing Act shall not be construed:(1) As altering the provisions of any other act or acts dealing with the marketing of agricultural products or as detracting from the authorities provided for in any such acts;(2) As empowering the department to require cooperative marketing efforts of persons or groups within any segment of the agriculture industry, but shall be construed only to authorize such cooperative marketing efforts; or(3) As empowering the department to purchase or otherwise obtain agricultural products or commodities for the purpose of resale.SourceLaws 1979, LB 538, ยง 9;Laws 1988, LB 807, ยง 5.
